newsitem.title: USA: Computer Language still sees improved 1997.
newsitem.headline: Computer Language still sees improved 1997.

text.p: Computer Language Research Inc Thursday reiterated that it expects revenue growth in 1997 of about 13 percent to 15 percent.

The company also repeated a forecast from earlier in the year that 1997 operating margins for 1997, excluding amortization and other acquisition-related charges, will return to more historical levels. Those levels are also in the range of 13 to 15 percent.
In 1996 the company said revenue growth was 16.7 percent over 1995.
The company said pre-acquisition margins, excluding amortization and other acquisition-related charges, was about 11 percent in 1996.

Computer Language noted at the time of its fiscal first quarter report in late February that some 12 acquisitions during 1995 and 1996 had depressed operating results for those periods below normal levels.
